subject: Ethics
title: Global Health Equity
description: A fast breakdown of Global Health Equity for builders.

hook.text: During COVID, rich countries hoarded vaccines while poor countries waited. Some call it 'vaccine apartheid.'

buildup.text: People in wealthy nations live 20 years longer on average than those in the poorest countries.

discovery.text: Global health equity means everyone deserves a fair chance at health regardless of where they were born.

twist.text: But pharmaceutical patents keep drug prices high in poor countriesâ€”protecting profits over people's lives.

climax.text: COVAX tried to distribute vaccines fairly. Rich nations bought their way to the front of the line anyway.

punchline.text: Your zip code predicts your lifespan. That's the crisis.

quiz.question: What undermined COVAX's goal of equitable global vaccine distribution?
options: Poor countries refused to accept donated vaccines
There weren't enough vaccines produced worldwide
Wealthy nations secured priority access, buying their way to the front of the line
